values.description:
First working version of the ROS API checker. This tool verifies the presences
of a ROS API that is described in a YAML file. It'll take in multiple YAML
files, merging their contents, which makes it easy to break the API definition
up into reusable pieces. For each topic given in the API definition, the tool
will verify the presence of the topic, its type, and the number of publishers
and subscribers (-1 means don't care for the publisher/subscriber count).

The tool supports a `strict` flag; if set, it will perform an extra test to
compare the output of `rostopic list` to the set of topics given in the API
definition. If they're not equal (which means that some extra, unexpected,
topics are either advertised or subscribed), that test will fail.


In this version, there are tests for:

* atlas_drc_vehicle_fire_hose_rosapi.launch
* atlas_golf_cart_fire_hose_rosapi.launch
* atlas_rosapi.launch
* atlas_sandia_hands_rosapi.launch
* drc_sim_v0_rosapi.launch
* qual_task_1_rosapi.launch
* qual_task_2_rosapi.launch
* qual_task_3_rosapi.launch
* qual_task_4_rosapi.launch
* vrc_task_1_rosapi.launch
* vrc_task_2_rosapi.launch
* vrc_task_3_rosapi.launch

`strict` is set for all of these tests.

This tool should eventually migrate out of drcsim and into ROS somewhere, likely
rostest.
values.title: ROS API checking tool

First working version of the ROS API checker. This tool verifies the presences
of a ROS API that is described in a YAML file. It'll take in multiple YAML
files, merging their contents, which makes it easy to break the API definition
up into reusable pieces. For each topic given in the API definition, the tool
will verify the presence of the topic, its type, and the number of publishers
and subscribers (-1 means don't care for the publisher/subscriber count).

The tool supports a `strict` flag; if set, it will perform an extra test to
compare the output of `rostopic list` to the set of topics given in the API
definition. If they're not equal (which means that some extra, unexpected,
topics are either advertised or subscribed), that test will fail.


In this version, there are tests for:

* atlas_drc_vehicle_fire_hose_rosapi.launch

This tool should eventually migrate out of drcsim and into ROS somewhere, likely
rostest.
summary.html:
First working version of the ROS API checker. This tool verifies the presences of a ROS API that is described in a YAML file. It'll take in multiple YAML files, merging their contents, which makes it easy to break the API definition up into reusable pieces. For each topic given in the API definition, the tool will verify the presence of the topic, its type, and the number of publishers and subscribers (-1 means don't care for the publisher/subscriber count).

The tool supports a strict flag; if set, it will perform an extra test to compare the output of rostopic list to the set of topics given in the API definition. If they're not equal (which means that some extra, unexpected, topics are either advertised or subscribed), that test will fail.

In this version, there are tests for:

  • atlas_drc_vehicle_fire_hose_rosapi.launch
  • atlas_golf_cart_fire_hose_rosapi.launch
  • atlas_rosapi.launch
  • atlas_sandia_hands_rosapi.launch

values.description:
**Inertia Updates**

This inertia updates are based on following algorithm:

  * In the constrained direction, (fortunately for Atlas, affected principal axis aligns with the link axis),
    Principal Moments of Inertia (MOI) are distributed equally between connected links.  This change should
    have no effect on the dynamics of the overall system (and should probably be performed autonomously
    by LCP solvers in general).
  * In unconstrained directions, limit the mass ratio across connected links to a manually defined ratio.,
    This change does affect CG location and overall inertia of links, but we check to see that
    the overall CG change is not significant.
  * In unconstrained directions, change the MOI so ratio across the joint is limited.
    This is not done in any consistent manner in this commit.  For example, the talus IXX is directly
    set as 0.5 * IXX of foot.

**Links Affected**

 * There are 3 link chains being updated. In each of these chains, the intermediate link(s) have much smaller inertia than the end links:

   1. utorso <back_ubx> mtorso <back_mby> ltorso <back_lbz> pelvis
      * mass is distributed 5:1 across utorso and mtorso links.  Anticipating utorso link might grow
        significantly with the addition of Atlas power pack.
      * IYY is bewteen utorso and mtorso is distributed equally.
      * IXX of mtorso is set to 0.5 of mtorso IXX.
      * mass is distributed 10:1 across pelvis:ltorso.  Overall CG change is checked to make sure it’s
        not significant (change of 0.409, 0, -0.861mm).
      * IZZ of utorso, mtorso and ltorso distributed equally.
        Overall IZZ of utorso, mtorso, ltorso at lbz is checked to make sure there are no changes.
      * IYY, IXX of pelvis and ltorso are distributed equally, being constrained, should not affect dynamics.

   1. pelvis <*_leg_uhz> *_uglut <*_leg_mhx> *_lglut <*_leg_lhy> *_uleg
      * This adjustment is done after the adjustments in a) are performed.
      * mass is distributed 10:1 between pelvis:uglut, uleg:lglut.  Checking CG shift (-0.405, 0.227, -1.561mm).
      * IZZ distributed equally between uglut, lglut and uleg, and check combined IZZ about uleg/lbz for sanity.
      * IYY distributed equally between pelvis, uglut, lglut, and check combined IYY about pelvis link for sanity.
      * IXX distributed euqally between uglut and pelvis.  Constrained in x, so should have no effect
        on dynamics.  Check combined IXX of pelvis and uglut about lglut(mhx).
      * IXX distributed euqally between lglut and uleg.  Constrained, so should have no effect on dynamics.
        Check combined IXX of lglut and uleg about lglut(mhx).

   1. *_lleg <l_leg_uay> *_talus <l_leg_lax> *_foot
      * mass is distributed between talus and foot link.  Afterwards, CG of both links combined is checked
        to ensure it has not moved much.
      * IYY is distributed equally between talus and foot, given y-direction is constrained, it does
        not really matter how we distribute them.
      * IXX of talus is set to 0.5 * (IXX of foot).  Foot IXX is held constant so same response is expected.
        Combined IXX of foot and talus is check to make sure there are no significant changes (3.67%).
      * IZZ (like IYY) is distributed equally between talus and foot with no impact to simulation dynamics.

 * Also, hokuyo_link of the MultiSense SL sensor has much smaller inertia then its parent link (head).
      * IYY IZZ distributed equally between head and hokuyo_link (being constrained).
      * IXX of hokuyo_link is set to 1/10 of head and hokuyo_link combined IXX.
values.title: === Inertia Updates ===

summary.raw:
**Inertia Updates**

This inertia updates are based on following algorithm:

  * In the constrained direction, (fortunately for Atlas, affected principal axis aligns with the link axis),
    Principal Moments of Inertia (MOI) are distributed equally between connected links.  This change should
    have no effect on the dynamics of the overall system (and should probably be performed autonomously
    by LCP solvers in general).
  * In unconstrained directions, limit the mass ratio across connected links to a manually defined ratio.,
    This change does affect CG location and overall inertia of links, but we check to see that
    the overall CG change is not significant.
  * In unconstrained directions, change the MOI so ratio across the joint is limited.
    This is not done in any consistent manner in this commit.  For example, the talus IXX is directly
    set as 0.5 * IXX of foot.

**Links Affected**

 * There are 3 link chains being updated. In each of these chains, the intermediate link(s) have much smaller inertia than the end links:

   1. utorso <back_ubx> mtorso <back_mby> ltorso <back_lbz> pelvis
      * mass is distributed 5:1 across utorso and mtorso links.  Anticipating utorso link might grow
        significantly with the addition of Atlas power pack.
      * IYY is bewteen utorso and mtorso is distributed equally.
      * IXX of mtorso is set to 0.5 of mtorso IXX.
      * mass is distributed 10:1 across pelvis:ltorso.  Overall CG change is checked to make sure it’s
        not significant (change of 0.409, 0, -0.861mm).
      * IZZ of utorso, mtorso and ltorso distributed equally.
        Overall IZZ of utorso, mtorso, ltorso at lbz is checked to make sure there are no changes.
      * IYY, IXX of pelvis and ltorso are distributed equally, being constrained, should not affect dynamics.

   1. pelvis <*_leg_uhz> *_uglut <*_leg_mhx> *_lglut <*_leg_lhy> *_uleg
      * This adjustment is done after the adjustments in a) are performed.
      * mass is distributed 10:1 between pelvis:uglut, uleg:lglut.  Checking CG shift (-0.405, 0.227, -1.561mm).
      * IZZ distributed equally between uglut, lglut and uleg, and check combined IZZ about uleg/lbz for sanity.
      * IYY distributed equally between pelvis, uglut, lglut, and check combined IYY about pelvis link for sanity.
      * IXX distributed euqally between uglut and pelvis.  Constrained in x, so should have no effect
        on dynamics.  Check combined IXX of pelvis and uglut about lglut(mhx).
      * IXX distributed euqally between lglut and uleg.  Constrained, so should have no effect on dynamics.
        Check combined IXX of lglut and uleg about lglut(mhx).

   1. *_lleg <l_leg_uay> *_talus <l_leg_lax> *_foot
      * mass is distributed between talus and foot link.  Afterwards, CG of both links combined is checked
        to ensure it has not moved much.
      * IYY is distributed equally between talus and foot, given y-direction is constrained, it does
        not really matter how we distribute them.
      * IXX of talus is set to 0.5 * (IXX of foot).  Foot IXX is held constant so same response is expected.
        Combined IXX of foot and talus is check to make sure there are no significant changes (3.67%).
      * IZZ (like IYY) is distributed equally between talus and foot with no impact to simulation dynamics.

 * Also, hokuyo_link of the MultiSense SL sensor has much smaller inertia then its parent link (head).
      * IYY IZZ distributed equally between head and hokuyo_link (being constrained).
      * IXX of hokuyo_link is set to 1/10 of head and hokuyo_link combined IXX.
summary.html:
Inertia Updates

This inertia updates are based on following algorithm:

  • In the constrained direction, (fortunately for Atlas, affected principal axis aligns with the link axis), Principal Moments of Inertia (MOI) are distributed equally between connected links. This change should have no effect on the dynamics of the overall system (and should probably be performed autonomously by LCP solvers in general).
  • In unconstrained directions, limit the mass ratio across connected links to a manually defined ratio., This change does affect CG location and overall inertia of links, but we check to see that the overall CG change is not significant.
  • In unconstrained directions, change the MOI so ratio across the joint is limited. This is not done in any consistent manner in this commit. For example, the talus IXX is directly set as 0.5 * IXX of foot.

Links Affected

  • There are 3 link chains being updated. In each of these chains, the intermediate link(s) have much smaller inertia than the end links:

  1. utorso <back_ubx> mtorso <back_mby> ltorso <back_lbz> pelvis

    • mass is distributed 5:1 across utorso and mtorso links. Anticipating utorso link might grow significantly with the addition of Atlas power pack.
    • IYY is bewteen utorso and mtorso is distributed equally.
    • IXX of mtorso is set to 0.5 of mtorso IXX.
    • mass is distributed 10:1 across pelvis:ltorso. Overall CG change is checked to make sure it’s not significant (change of 0.409, 0, -0.861mm).
    • IZZ of utorso, mtorso and ltorso distributed equally. Overall IZZ of utorso, mtorso, ltorso at lbz is checked to make sure there are no changes.
    • IYY, IXX of pelvis and ltorso are distributed equally, being constrained, should not affect dynamics.

  2. pelvis <_leg_uhz> _uglut <_leg_mhx> _lglut <_leg_lhy> _uleg

    • This adjustment is done after the adjustments in a) are performed.
    • mass is distributed 10:1 between pelvis:uglut, uleg:lglut. Checking CG shift (-0.405, 0.227, -1.561mm).
    • IZZ distributed equally between uglut, lglut and uleg, and check combined IZZ about uleg/lbz for sanity.
    • IYY distributed equally between pelvis, uglut, lglut, and check combined IYY about pelvis link for sanity.
    • IXX distributed euqally between uglut and pelvis. Constrained in x, so should have no effect on dynamics. Check combined IXX of pelvis and uglut about lglut(mhx).
    • IXX distributed euqally between lglut and uleg. Constrained, so should have no effect on dynamics. Check combined IXX of lglut and uleg about lglut(mhx).

  3. _lleg <l_leg_uay> _talus <l_leg_lax> *_foot

    • mass is distributed between talus and foot link. Afterwards, CG of both links combined is checked to ensure it has not moved much.
    • IYY is distributed equally between talus and foot, given y-direction is constrained, it does not really matter how we distribute them.
    • IXX of talus is set to 0.5 * (IXX of foot). Foot IXX is held constant so same response is expected. Combined IXX of foot and talus is check to make sure there are no significant changes (3.67%).
    • IZZ (like IYY) is distributed equally between talus and foot with no impact to simulation dynamics.
  • Also, hokuyo_link of the MultiSense SL sensor has much smaller inertia then its parent link (head).
    • IYY IZZ distributed equally between head and hokuyo_link (being constrained).
    • IXX of hokuyo_link is set to 1/10 of head and hokuyo_link combined IXX.

values.title: Add Gaussian noise to laser (+ plugin rewrite)

summary.html:
Added Gaussian noise to model of laser in multisense-sl, per issue #159.

To make it work, I extensively restructured the gazebo_ros_laser plugin, making it much simpler. Now it has no threads after loading is finished. When the first ROS subscriber hooks up, the plugin subscribes to the Gazebo laser sensor. When Gazebo publishes a new laser message, the plugin receives it, converts it to ROS laser message, then publishes it. When the last ROS subscriber disconnects, the plugin unsubscribes from the Gazebo sensor.

@hsu : I don't think that I broke anything here, but would appreciate your eyes on it.

values.description:
Thanks to @jpages for the patch.

By looking at [gazebo_ros_multicamera.cpp lines 95, 116](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/fabf5b11ad4818ab3337d833e5089ea08a36aa5f/ros/atlas_msgs/gazebo_ros_multicamera.cpp?at=default#cl-95) you can see that this function call is missing for the single camera plugin.

values.title: make atlas control loop messages udp friendly (< 1500 bytes)
values.reason: going to move atlas_msgs/AtlasCommand to a new topic (atlas/atlas_command), and keep /atlas/joint_commands on the old osrf_msg/JointCommands message.  Change the old JointCommands/JointState loop to tcpnodelay, keep AtlasCommand/AtlasState loop on udp.  Will submit a new pull request when changes are made.

values.title: add /atlas/atlas_command and /atlas/atlas_state messages for UDP (<  1500 Bytes)

values.description:
This pull requests adds the gazebo_ros_force plugin to enable to apply forces (perturbations) to the robot's pelvis.

This adds the plugin to get compiled as well as adds to the atlas.gazebo urdf file to load the plugin to enable forces to the pelvis.
values.title: Added gazebo_ros_force plugin (was pull request #138)

summary.raw:
This pull requests adds the gazebo_ros_force plugin to enable to apply forces (perturbations) to the robot's pelvis.

This adds the plugin to get compiled as well as adds to the atlas.gazebo urdf file to load the plugin to enable forces to the pelvis.
summary.html:
This pull requests adds the gazebo_ros_force plugin to enable to apply forces (perturbations) to the robot's pelvis.

This adds the plugin to get compiled as well as adds to the atlas.gazebo urdf file to load the plugin to enable forces to the pelvis.


values.description:
Mostly based on gazebo doxygen model

It includes the BDI doxygen information which is already in the drcsim repository. To test:
```
cd build && cmake ..
make doc
${BROWSER} doxygen/html/index.html
```

Once reviewed we should find a place to upload it via jenkins. What about gazebosim.org/drcsim/api/ ?

UPDATE:

I'm allowing doxygen to go through BDI headers files so in the list of all classes we also have theirs. They can be taken out, if needed.

The doxygen group for DRC Plugins is just an example. Probably we need to define proper group which are useful for users.
values.title: Initial support to generate doxygen info

It includes the BDI doxygen information which is already in the drcsim repository. To test:

summary.html:
Mostly based on gazebo doxygen model

It includes the BDI doxygen information which is already in the drcsim repository. To test:

cd build && cmake ..
make doc
${BROWSER} doxygen/html/index.html

Once reviewed we should find a place to upload it via jenkins. What about gazebosim.org/drcsim/api/ ?

UPDATE:

I'm allowing doxygen to go through BDI headers files so in the list of all classes we also have theirs. They can be taken out, if needed.

The doxygen group for DRC Plugins is just an example. Probably we need to define proper group which are useful for users.

values.description:
If you like these changes, then approve pull request #173

Manually applied the diff between AtlasSimInterface_1.0.5 and udp_tweak,
excluding changes in the plugins/ directory. The goal is produce a pull request
that bitbucket can render for review in place of #173, which has huge changes in
the BDI library, confined to the plugins/ directory.

Specifically, I did the following:
    
    hg diff -r udp_tweak -r AtlasSimInterface_1.0.5 --exclude "plugins/*" > /tmp/d
    hg up udp_tweak
    hg branch surrogate_for_173_do_not_merge
    patch -p1 < /tmp/d
values.title: [DO NOT MERGE] Surrogate for pull request #173

summary.raw:
If you like these changes, then approve pull request #173

Manually applied the diff between AtlasSimInterface_1.0.5 and udp_tweak,
excluding changes in the plugins/ directory. The goal is produce a pull request
that bitbucket can render for review in place of #173, which has huge changes in
the BDI library, confined to the plugins/ directory.

Specifically, I did the following:
    
    hg diff -r udp_tweak -r AtlasSimInterface_1.0.5 --exclude "plugins/*" > /tmp/d
    hg up udp_tweak
    hg branch surrogate_for_173_do_not_merge
    patch -p1 < /tmp/d
summary.html:
If you like these changes, then approve pull request #173

Manually applied the diff between AtlasSimInterface_1.0.5 and udp_tweak, excluding changes in the plugins/ directory. The goal is produce a pull request that bitbucket can render for review in place of #173, which has huge changes in the BDI library, confined to the plugins/ directory.

Specifically, I did the following:

hg diff -r udp_tweak -r AtlasSimInterface_1.0.5 --exclude "plugins/*" > /tmp/d
hg up udp_tweak
hg branch surrogate_for_173_do_not_merge
patch -p1 < /tmp/d

values.description:
Per Eric Krotkov’s request @faller and I have been working on improving the visual textures for the VRC arenas.

These changes are split into pull-requests across three repositories, please merge at the same time:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-request/26/new-vrc-textures/diff
* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/435/new-vrc-textures/diff
* #!/osrf/drcsim/pull-request/187/new-vrc-textures/diff

### Changelist: ###

* added texture to mud

* improved grass texture in manipulation and driving tasks

* added randomized texture to rubble

* changed texture sizes in heightmaps to improve resolution (also reduces increased parallax, the remaining parallax needs to be fixed by fixing heightmap or using a trimesh instead, see [gazebo issue 572](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/572/vrc-heightmap-problems))

* replaced grass texture in walking task heightmap

* added structured texture to valve, spigot, and hose coupling (color can be changed via material script) - not perfect but best we could do with the limited amount of time we have

* removed light from manipulation area in task3 to be able to see texture on objects properly

* turned off lighting for house_1 model as global lighting in driving task made it appear way too bright

* added brick texture to starting pen

* added brick wall between manipulation area and gas station

* changed initial camera view in vrc tasks to have better overview

### Pictures of new arenas:###

* http://www.seas.upenn.edu/~thomasko/new_vrc_arenas/new_vrc_task1.png

* http://www.seas.upenn.edu/~thomasko/new_vrc_arenas/new_vrc_task2_view0.png

* http://www.seas.upenn.edu/~thomasko/new_vrc_arenas/new_vrc_task2_view1.png

* http://www.seas.upenn.edu/~thomasko/new_vrc_arenas/new_vrc_task3_view0.png

* http://www.seas.upenn.edu/~thomasko/new_vrc_arenas/new_vrc_task3_view1.png

Everyone please feel free to give feedback / issue (reasonable) concerns if some change doesn’t work for your team or if you have a change yourself you want to contribute (I’ll give you write permissions to commit to the fork).

Thanks to Maurice (MIT) for collaborating and to Max (JPL) for providing feedback.

-Thomas
values.title: New VRC Textures

summary.html:
Per Eric Krotkov’s request @faller and I have been working on improving the visual textures for the VRC arenas.

These changes are split into pull-requests across three repositories, please merge at the same time:

  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-request/26/new-vrc-textures/diff
  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/435/new-vrc-textures/diff
  • #!/osrf/drcsim/pull-request/187/new-vrc-textures/diff

Changelist:

  • added texture to mud

  • improved grass texture in manipulation and driving tasks

  • added randomized texture to rubble

  • changed texture sizes in heightmaps to improve resolution (also reduces increased parallax, the remaining parallax needs to be fixed by fixing heightmap or using a trimesh instead, see gazebo issue 572)

  • replaced grass texture in walking task heightmap

  • added structured texture to valve, spigot, and hose coupling (color can be changed via material script) - not perfect but best we could do with the limited amount of time we have

  • removed light from manipulation area in task3 to be able to see texture on objects properly

  • turned off lighting for house_1 model as global lighting in driving task made it appear way too bright

  • added brick texture to starting pen

  • added brick wall between manipulation area and gas station

  • changed initial camera view in vrc tasks to have better overview

Pictures of new arenas:

  • http://www.seas.upenn.edu/~thomasko/new_vrc_arenas/new_vrc_task1.png

  • http://www.seas.upenn.edu/~thomasko/new_vrc_arenas/new_vrc_task2_view0.png

  • http://www.seas.upenn.edu/~thomasko/new_vrc_arenas/new_vrc_task2_view1.png

  • http://www.seas.upenn.edu/~thomasko/new_vrc_arenas/new_vrc_task3_view0.png

  • http://www.seas.upenn.edu/~thomasko/new_vrc_arenas/new_vrc_task3_view1.png

Everyone please feel free to give feedback / issue (reasonable) concerns if some change doesn’t work for your team or if you have a change yourself you want to contribute (I’ll give you write permissions to commit to the fork).

Thanks to Maurice (MIT) for collaborating and to Max (JPL) for providing feedback.

-Thomas

values.description:
This adds a keyboard teleop, which allows for easy adjustment of the step parameters.

This also adds a few small tweaks to the action server to handle step trajectories of two and three steps.
values.title: Adding keyboard_teleop and minor adjustments to walking action server

values.description:
Based on [this question](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/2320/drcsim-atlas-urdf-glitches/).

Made best guess on fixes to equalize limits in one case and provide opposite signs in another case.

Definitely needs review from more physics-minded people than me.
values.title: Fixes to Atlas limits and inertias

values.description:
Taking [inspiration](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/434/allow-world-with-a-name-other-than-default/diff) from @nkoenig, I cleaned up the drcsim test suite in `atlas_utils`.  They should now all pass.

Because the tests are performance-based, they're only run when a GPU is present; this is a proxy for having a sufficiently powerful machine to hit the targets.

While I was in there, I downgraded some warning/info messages to debug, so that they're not displayed under normal circumstances.  There are still more console messages to remove to have a clean launch.
values.title: Fix tests + console cleanup

summary.raw:
Taking [inspiration](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/434/allow-world-with-a-name-other-than-default/diff) from @nkoenig, I cleaned up the drcsim test suite in `atlas_utils`.  They should now all pass.

Because the tests are performance-based, they're only run when a GPU is present; this is a proxy for having a sufficiently powerful machine to hit the targets.

While I was in there, I downgraded some warning/info messages to debug, so that they're not displayed under normal circumstances.  There are still more console messages to remove to have a clean launch.
summary.html:
Taking inspiration from @nkoenig, I cleaned up the drcsim test suite in atlas_utils. They should now all pass.

Because the tests are performance-based, they're only run when a GPU is present; this is a proxy for having a sufficiently powerful machine to hit the targets.

While I was in there, I downgraded some warning/info messages to debug, so that they're not displayed under normal circumstances. There are still more console messages to remove to have a clean launch.

values.description:
Initial version of atlas_arenas_start_testing.launch which should start:

* All logging mechanisms (via atlas_arenas_logging.launch): Script to run recordmydesktop is included.
* Teleop for atlas (still pending of teleop inclusion in default)

For qual_task1 then enable of gazebo logging state is disable until check if performance drop is reasonable.
